Tip of the Month

Strategically Include Links in Your FAQs

You may have noticed that Google will give instant Q&A in the search results. Try searching “estate planning FAQs,” for example. While many people click to view an answer to a question, they may not be directed to your website if you do not include an internal link in the first paragraph. We recommend doing so on any FAQ pages that you post so that users may click through to your firm’s site from these results.

Tech News

Censored Chinese Search Project is “Terminated,” Google Rep Testifies

A Google representative announced that it has ended work on Project Dragonfly, its controversial Chinese search engine.

Appeals Court Rules Amazon Can Be Held Liable for Third-Party Products

The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit recently ruled that Amazon may be held liable for faulty products sold by third parties sold on its platform.

US Appeals Court Rules Trump Violated First Amendment by Blocking Twitter Followers

The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled that President Trump’s blocking of critics to his Twitter account was unconstitutional viewpoint discrimination under the First Amendment.

Employee Activism is Alive in Tech. It Stops Short of Organizing Unions.

Tech workers in Silicon Valley have increasingly engaged in activism, though not formation of unions, at some of the largest companies in the region.

SEO News

The Need for Speed in Search: 5 Speed Types to Master Now

To be competitive in search, you must audit and optimize desktop and mobile page speeds while also making data ready for real-time personalization.

Google Made 3,200 Changes to Search in the Past Year

Google made over 3,200 changes to its search system last year alone, reminding everyone that you should continually invest in improving your website.

Google Explains the Process for Rolling Out Changes to Search Results

In a blog post, Google recently explained that it implements changes to search results by making algorithmic changes that apply to a broad range of searches.

5% of Google My Business Listing Views Result in a Customer Action

A new study from BrightLocal reveals some fascinating information about how customers are finding and interacting with Google My Business listings.

Did You Know?

ABA Announces Launch Of Online Platform to Connect Volunteer Lawyers Across the U.S. with Unaccompanied Immigrant Children Who Need Representation

Asylum-seekers who have legal representation have a five-times-greater chance of winning their case. In an effort to help unrepresented immigrant children who face federal deportation, the ABA has launched a new online platform, Pro Bono Matters for Children Facing Deportation, where interested attorneys can now search for unaccompanied immigrant children's cases, connecting them with children who need a lawyer. Click here, for more information and to learn more about the program.

Social Media News

Twitter is Changing Twitter.com to be More Like Mobile App

Twitter will unify the mobile and desktop experience on its website by tailoring each component of the site to individual users.

The US Government is Fining Facebook $5 Billion for Privacy Violations, and Wall Street Thinks That’s Great News

News of the relatively small penalty against the social media giant increased its stock price, and signaled to investors that regulators will not require significant changes to Facebook’s business operations any time soon.

Facebook’s Libra Cryptocurrency Attacked at Senate Hearing

Multiple senators have questioned Facebook’s cryptocurrency plans in light of its recent privacy and election-related scandals.

Instagram Expands its Test of Removing Like Counts

Instagram has been running tests in multiple countries outside of the U.S. in which users do not see a post’s like counts or any likes at all.

A Pug’s Tale

Rest in Peace, MaoMao

This month we had to say goodbye to Hug Pug MaoMao. At 11 years old, he was Justia's youngest pug and still acted like a puppy! He was strong, smart, brave, loving, and brought joy to all of his Justia peeps. We are lucky to have had him in our lives and he will be sorely missed.

Legal Industry News

Justice John Paul Stevens, Dead at 99, Promoted the Internet Revolution

The former Supreme Court Justice had a pivotal voice in numerous opinions related to promoting Internet technology as we know it today.

Nonlawyers Could Offer Legal Advice and Partly Own Law Firms Under These California Proposals

California’s State Bar is seeking public comment on proposals that would allow non-lawyers to provide specified legal services and to have a financial stake in law firms.
